Once you have a SUPR account, you can apply for compute and storage resources through the **SLU Local 2026** round.

## Before You Apply

Prepare the following information:

- Project title and short description  
- Estimated compute needs (cores, memory, runtime)  
- Estimated storage needs (GB or TB, and expected duration)  
- Internal project number or cost centre for billing (**[MORE INFO NEEDED: required SLU financial details]**)

## Find the “SLU Local 2026” Call in SUPR

 **[MORE INFO NEEDED]**

1. Log in to SUPR: <https://supr.naiss.se>  
2. Go to the section for **Rounds** on the menu on the left side.  
3. Below the panels for the different default rounds, click: **"You can also view all rounds (including closed and decided)."" **
4. Under **"Local Rounds"** select **"SLU Local 2026"**
5. Click **"Create new proposal"** to start a new application.

## Fill in the Application



Typical sections include:

### Project Information

- **Project title**  
- **Scientific area** (e.g. bioinformatics, genomics, ecology)  
- **Short abstract** in clear, non-technical language  
- **Extended description** of methods and type of analyses

### Resources Requested

Describe what you need on:

- **Gorilla**  
- **Pelle**  
- **Lutra**  

For each system, specify:

- type of workload (e.g. RNA-seq, WGS, metagenomics, modelling)  
- number of cores / nodes needed  
- expected walltime per job  
- total compute hours required over the project period  
- storage needs (active project storage and any longer-term storage)

**[MORE INFO NEEDED: specific unit used for compute accounting – core hours, CPU hours, GPU hours, etc.]**

### Project Members

Add:

- PI and co-applicants  
- other users who should have access to the allocation  

All listed users normally need a SUPR account.

### Budget and Billing

Provide:

- SLU project number and/or cost centre  
- responsible person for the budget  

**[MORE INFO NEEDED: exact format of project numbers and any required reference text for invoices]**

## Submission and Review

1. Check that all mandatory fields are completed.  
2. Submit the application in SUPR.  
3. You will receive a confirmation email from SUPR.  
4. The application is reviewed according to SLU and NAISS procedures.  
5. You are notified by email when the allocation has been approved.

**[MORE INFO NEEDED: expected review time and decision schedule]**

## 5. After Approval

When your application is approved:

- The project and allocation are created in SUPR.  
- Users added to the project are granted access to the selected systems.  
- You can immediately proceed to connect and start using the resources:
